result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- $100 fine plus costs including DNA surcharge, Dom. Surcharge and Atty. fees.  The Court continues the $75 per month payment plan already ordered in this case for payment of the financial obligations.

**Per standing order ( see attached) in the event of non payment the saction for failure to pay as ordered is 15 days jail consecutive to any other sentence in being with Huber. If Huber is used the defendant  is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

The Court continues the $75 per month payment plan already ordered in this case for payment of the financial obligations. Case called at 1:22pm [ma]
Defendant Brian L Harvey in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

The Court makes domestic abuse finding.

Atty. Luchsinger requests a sentencing be scheduled out 30 days.

Case called at 1:47 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mac J. Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Brian L Harvey in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses non-payment of attorney fees; Mr. Harvey informs the Court that he was not aware he was to make any payments for attorney fees - Court admonishes defendant regarding lack of payment, reminds him that payments are $75 per month and informs him that he has another payment due next week and expects to have an update regarding made payments at next hearing.
Atty Luchsinger informs the Court that he has informed the DAs office of some Veterans programs that Mr. Harvey is participating in that may have some effect on the outcome of this case, request the Court set this matter out for an additional STC in a few weeks.
ADA Shock informs the Court that the State has no objections

[MK] case called at 11:14am. 
Defendant Brian L Harvey in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $150 Cash Bond (the amount of $350 was already posted; the clerk is to refund the amount of $200), with added conditions: 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--to take medications as prescribed
-no discussion of the case with Melissa Harvey
-Mr. Harvey is to provide the pistol he possesses to an independant adult friend or family member, and then he is to provide written verification of this to the Court and to the District Attorney
-no possession of revolvers or pistols
recess 11:19am
